712772f-a.text:
42nd Street, south side, west from the clearing at No. 340 East 42nd Street, Prospect Hill, between First and Second Avenues,
as the Tudor City development begins.
May 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

712774f.text:
42nd Street, west from First Avenue, through the Prospect Hill
tunnel under the future site of Tudor City.
Probably 1927.
Brown Brothers.

707606f-a.text:
First Avenue, west side, north from 42nd Street.
March 5, 1928.
New York Edison Company Collection.

712792f-a.text:
East 42nd Street (prominent structures thereon) west from First (right, not seen) to Lexington (left) Avenues, showing the Chrysler and the News Buildings under construction. The first is at the northeast corner of Lexington Avenue and 42nd Street, while the latter is on the south side of 42nd Street, between First and Second Avenues. Photographer's vantage point is atop a roof on 40th Street, east of Second Avenue, and viewing northwestward.

August 16, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

712768f-a.text:
East 42nd Street, south side, west from the East River to First Avenue. Shown in the background are two units of Tudor City: the Windsor Tower (left) and the Tudor Tower (right).

March 31, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

712775f-b.text:
East 42nd Street, west from First Avenue, showing the enclosed passageway through which the streetcars pass. Atop same is the residential locale Tudor City. This in earlier days was a rocky wasteland populated by a group of "Shanty Irish" led by one Cocoran, for whom this became known as "Cocoran's Roost".

July 23, 1939

No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

712775f-a.text:
East 42nd Street, west from First Avenue, showing the enclosed passageway through which the streetcars pass. Atop same is the residential locale Tudor City. This in earlier days was a rocky wasteland populated by a group of "Shanty Irish" led by one Cocoran, for whom this became known as "Cocoran's Roost".

July 23, 1939

No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

712795f-a.text:
East 42nd Street, west from First Avenue, showing there the utilitarian News Building. Same, obstructs a clear view of the Chrysler Building at Lexington Avenue. The photographer's direction is northwestward from a point on East 40th Street.

1939

Gift of Beecher Ogden

712770f-b.text:
East 42nd Street, east from First Avenue, showing the terminus of this street at the East River. Under construction at the right is the Queens-Midtown Tunnel.

1: February 1940
2&3: Sept. 28, 1940

George D. Chinn
P. L. Sperr

712770f-c.text:
East 42nd Street, east from First Avenue, showing the terminus of this street at the East River. Under construction at the right is the Queens-Midtown Tunnel.

1: February 1940
2&3: Sept. 28, 1940

George D. Chinn
P. L. Sperr

707607f-a.text:
1)
First Avenue,looking Northwards from the Southwest corner
of East 42nd Street.
March 20th,1929
(2)
The same,looking North from East 42nd Street.
October 3rd, 1940

P.L.Sperr

712769f.text:
42nd Street, north side, east of and from First Avenue.
March 20, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

712771f-a.text:
View 1; and 2
E 42nd Street, south east corner and First Avenue showing Tunnel Ventitation Building at left.
October 3, 1940.
View3 :
5 W 42nd Street, north side and showing old buildings located bet ween the Salmon Tower building and Bristol.
P.L.Speer.
NO REPRODUCTION.  Fetruary 21, 1922.
